friday.description: Hack Arizona participants will check in at the tables in front of SEL starting at 4:30 PM
Expo prior to opening ceremony where participants can handout resumes and learn more about our sponsors
Dinner is provided by the Student Union
Welcoming our sponsors and participants to Hack Arizona 2018 with a special Keynote Speaker!

friday.subtitle: Opening Ceremony
friday.description: Those that cannot make the opening ceremony no worries! We have you covered with a live stream!
Don't have a team yet? No problem! Head to community area outside Henry Koffler at 9 PM for a meet and greet of other participants who don't have a team
No description has been provided for this event
Understanding Key Elements of a Successful Marketing Strategy
Learn to build a virtual model of the solar system. This workshop is presented by StateFarm and is from 10:30pm-12:30am

Come get some fresh air outside the hackathon and test you balance on our slackline! Slacklining is a alternative sport where hackers can walk and balance on a long piece of nylon rope strung between trees. Our slackline will be taught and only one foot off the ground so new and experienced hackers can enjoy slacking off!
Build conversational interfaces for apps, bots, and devices through the power of Natural Language Processing and Machine Learning using Wit.ai

Learn to build a static portfolio website, using HTM & CSS. Presented by Hack Arizona's Cooper Kunz, this is a fantastic workshop to attend if you are new to programming. This workshop is from 11:30pm-1:30am
What is … answering questions to win an AWESOME prize?? Head to the Live Stream Studio to join in on all the Jeopardy action.

saturday.description: Model the solar system in Java. This workshop is presented by Hack Arizona's Hannah Parraga and will go from 13:30am-2:30am

saturday.subtitle: Static Websites
saturday.description: This workshop by Hack Arizona's firstByte Director Cooper Kunz will show you how to use GitHub Pages and Cloudflare to deploy your websites. This workshop lasts until 2:30am
Breakfast provided by the Student Union
Ever wonder how internet-of-things devices are hacked? Come learn about the buffer overflow vulnerability as well as an explanation of the recent  Meltdown and Spectre exploits.
Using biometrics to reduce or eliminate the risk associated with online identification of your accounts. Presented by StateFarm

Yoga is a great way to clear your head and recharge your body in the midst. A recently graduated UA graduate student has offered to volunteer her skills in some relaxing and energizing yoga on the mall.

saturday.subtitle: Machine Learning
saturday.description: Using Scala and Apache Spark MLib, Srini Vemula is going to give you a taste in Large Scale Machine Learning from 9:30am-12:30pm

At the UA Hackathon, we support our hackers, volunteers, organizers, and mentors who are in recovery. There will be a 12 step meeting on Saturday at 10:00am in the iSpace (2nd floor of the Science and Engineering Library) open to anyone working a 12 step recovery program. If you would like information about meetings in Tucson for additional meetings or support for AA, Alanon, SLAA, or NA, you can find links to them below. If your program isn't listed here and you need help finding resources, feel free to email stephensrec@gmail.com and we can help you find the right meeting. http://aatucson.org/ http://www.al-anon-southernaz.org/ http://www.tucsonslaa.org/ http://www.natucson.org/meetinglist.php

saturday.subtitle: time with WebSockets
saturday.description: Learn about node.js, react.js, yarn, websockets, and publishing a web application to github pages. We will be building a chat application using FaceBook’s create-react-app and a websocket api.  All source code will be published to github during the presentation. Presented by Go Daddy

saturday.subtitle: Get Started Learning Unity
saturday.description: Hack Arizona's Robert Johnson is going to give you some insight VR using Unity. This workshop is from 10:30am-12:30pm

saturday.subtitle: Google Cloud Platform
saturday.description: In this talk, we'll learn about 5 Machine Learning APIs, how to deploy an application to the cloud, and review the basic concepts of cloud. The talk is heavily focused on technologies that you can use in your hackathon projects!
Provided by the Student Union
The Pet Partners of Southern Arizona will be bringing therapy dogs to our hackathon again this year! Come hang out with all the puppers and doggos your heart can handle.

saturday.subtitle: Challenge
saturday.description: Write a program to detect if a sentence contains a palindrome. Prize: Gemma wearable computer. See challenge under events.

saturday.subtitle: Why Should We Care?
saturday.description: Paul Grumley and Curtis Wyatt, Software Systems Engineers from General Dynamics Mission Systems presenting a summary of cryptography.  Topics include a brief history, the fundamentals, and what it means to you in your personal and professional lives
Inara Lysne is here to teach you basics of Python and coding fundamentals. This is a great workshop to attend of you are new to programming, it goes from 1:00pm-3:00pm

saturday.subtitle: Challenge
saturday.description: Decrypt the hash 4e2ab1da03b6ebfaeff88d8bcdaea371. Prize: T-Shirt. See challenge under activities in the app
Fun trivia game!

saturday.subtitle: and Software for Use in Space
saturday.description: Tom Butler, Senior Engineering Manager from General Dynamics Mission Systems presenting an overview of engineering challenges when designing systems for use in space. Topics include architectural considerations, overcoming harsh environmental requirements, special processes and current space system examples.
Think you can build a website in 15 minutes with only one shot to run your code? Come take on this challenge brought to you by MLH. After the event there will be t-shirts given out!

saturday.subtitle: Challenge
saturday.description: Write a program to create an 8X8 crossword puzzle with and ONLY with the following words: RMS, BYTE, HACKAZ, EXCITE, SOFTWARE, HERTZ. Prize: Solar phone charger

saturday.subtitle: Challenge
saturday.description: What is the length and type of Raytheon's longest missile? Prize: Gemma wearable computer
CHUG! CHUG! CHUG! CHUG! Come shotgun a can to get your weekend started on the 3rd floor!
Probably our most anticipated activity of the hackathon, the Super Smash Brothers Melee Competition is a 4 hour tournament!

In the Healthcare industry, safety is a part of everything we do. With the oncoming AI revolution safety will take on an even greater role as software begins to interact more and more with the physical world. This talk will focus on how Sunquest Information Systems approaches the safety problem and how others might follow. Presented by Sunquest Information Systems

saturday.subtitle: Relay Games
saturday.description: The Elephant March is a wacky and fun relay race where students compete to swing and knock over bottles using only the tennis ball inside the nylons pulled over their head, it’s ridiculous to watch and hilarious to play! In the Donut Eating Race will compete to see who can finish a donut on a string the fastest above their head without their hands in our Donut Eating Contest.
Emoji game on point?? Head to the Live Stream studio to see if you can read our emoji phrases!

saturday.subtitle: …Bringing your builds to life!
saturday.description: This talk by Jacobs will focus on popular open hardware like Arduino and Rasberry Pi and demonstrate how they can be leveraged to control off the shelf electronics components to build your own customized electronics for wearables, robotics, IoT, etc. Presented by Jacobs

Learn the basics of JavaScript presented by Peter Fesz-Nguyen. This is a great workshop to build onto your knowledge of web dev, especially those of you that attended they Intro to Web Dev workshop. This workshop goes from 4:00pm-6:00pm

saturday.subtitle: Challenge
saturday.description: Create a program which makes a 10x10 initial Minesweeper game board.

saturday.subtitle: Challenge
saturday.description: Arizona is most well-known for its mining of what mineral? First person to stop by the Hexagon Mining table with the correct answer will win a prize!

saturday.subtitle: Challenge
saturday.description: Create a rock paper scissors AI in python. Come to Raytheon booth for details. Info session at 4PM and tournament at 7PM. Prize: Top 4 get to choose between August Smart lock, $50 gift card, or a  solar phone charger.

saturday.subtitle: Internet Scale
saturday.description: Using Flink, Superset and Druid. Amazon is going to show you how to Real-time Analytics work in this Tech Talk

saturday.subtitle: Improv Show
saturday.description: The Charles Darwin Experience is the University’s only all improv comedy group and this year they are making their Hack Arizona debut! Come be an active audience member in shouting out zany suggestions for the improvised games the Darwins will be playing in a fun “Whose Line Is It Anyway?” style performance.
Provided by Arizona Catering

saturday.subtitle: Challenge
saturday.description: The helmet of an astronaut’s space suit is coated with a very thin film of what mineral? Come to the Hexagon Mining table with the correct answer to win a prize

saturday.subtitle: making and how to fix them
saturday.description: You’ve had to deal with them as a user. They’re aggravating, they’re distracting--and you’re probably making them right now in your own apps. Alex and Mike talk about 5 of the most common app design mistakes and share techniques for avoiding them.

saturday.subtitle: with JQuery
saturday.description: Build on your recently learn JavaScript knowledge by implementing it with JQuery. Taught by Peter Fesz-Nguyen and runs from 7:00pm-9:00pm
Ready to step into the winners circle? Come join us in the Live Stream studio to play this classic game show game and maybe even win a cool prize!
Do you know your music? Head on down to the Live Stream studio to test your music knowledge!

saturday.subtitle: the Microsoft Design System
saturday.description: This talk is predominantly design related and showcases out approach to Fluent Design and evolving the Microsoft Design System. This talk will also focus on how we are incubating ideas & innovating (especially through code) in order to drive the system forwards.

Come participate in or simple be a spectator to our biggest activity of the hackathon, our comedy hypnotist! This unique and engaging show will convince the non-believers how influential the power of persuasion can have on the mind.
So you learned JavaScript, then you learned JavaScript with JQuery... you might as well keep on going cause Peter Fesz-Nguyen is going to teach you about Node.js from 10:30pm-12:30am

saturday.subtitle: iOS Development
saturday.description: Hackathon project not going so well? No worries! Cooper is here to get you up and running using Swift to develop and iOS app!
It’s time to play the feud! Bring your hacker squad to the Live Stream studio and test your groups knowledge!
This talk by Jacobs will take a high level look at the vulnerabilities and attack surfaces surrounding one the most rapidly expanding markets in tech today.
La La La Laaaa! Show us your vocal skills on the main floor and maybe even win a prize!

sunday.subtitle: A Popular Web Framework
sunday.description: So you've attended all the web dev workshops and you have a nice little website going. Now it's time to make it look fantastic! Cooper is here to show you how with the Bootstrap framework from 12:30am-2:30am
Come get lit with the Hack AZ squad at our dance party on the Main Floor
No description has been provided for this event
Hacking ends all participants must have submitted their projects by this time
Sponsor and devoded judges go around taking a look a submitted projects
The winner of the popular vote decided by the people is to be show cased.
